JUDGES: Isabelle Berro-Lefèvre;Karel Jungwiert;Mark Villiger;Mirjana Lazarova Trajkovska;Peer Lorenzen;Renate Jaeger;Volodymyr Butkevych
TEXT: The applicant , PERSON , is a NORP national who was born in DATE and lives in GPE ( GPE ) . He was represented before the ORG by Mr PERSON , a lawyer practising in GPE . ORG ( “ the Government ” ) were represented by their Agent , Mr PERSON , from ORG . The Government of GPE did not make use of their right to intervene ( Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL of the Convention ) .
The facts of the case , as submitted by the parties , may be summarised as follows .
On DATE , during his stay in GPE , the applicant ’s car was damaged by a snow excavator .

On DATE the applicant filed a motion seeking the issuance of a payment order and an action for damages with ORG ( okresní soud ) against the Pec pod GPE ( Město Pec pod GPE ) , the ORG pod GPE Services ( PERSON města Pec pod GPE ) and the owner of the excavator .
The proceedings terminated on DATE on the date on which a judgment of ORG of DATE became final .

On DATE the applicant applied for compensation pursuant to Act no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL as amended . He claimed ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL in respect of fees and expenses incurred in the domestic proceedings .

In a letter of CARDINAL DATE ORG informed the applicant that his application had been accepted , that it had been found that his right to a determination of his civil claim within a reasonable time had been violated , but that the length of the proceedings did not justify a financial compensation . ORG refused also the applicant ’s claim regarding compensation for pecuniary damage .
On DATE the applicant informed the Registry that he did not intend to turn to a court under section CARDINAL(CARDINAL ) of Act no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL as amended .

The relevant domestic law and practice concerning remedies for the excessive length of judicial proceedings are stated in the ORG ’s decision in the case of PERSON v. GPE , no . MONEY ( dec . ) , § § CARDINAL - CARDINAL , DATE )
